clauses.title: This service tracks which web page referred you to it
clauses.description: The service logs the URL of the last web page you visited before visiting the Site and may use that information to gather more data about you.

clauses.title: ToS;DR Provides an Onion Service
clauses.description: Tor is a software for anonymous communication that directs Internet traffic through an overlay network. Onion sites are only available through Tor browser and provide additional security and anonymity to users.

clauses.title: The service provides information about its attitude towards ethical, social or political problems or controversies
clauses.description: If a service expresses a worldview antithetical to the userâ€™s, that is a good signal that they should not use the service. Or conversely, if the service expresses an uncommonly-held belief that the user agrees with and thinks is relevant to the service-user relationship and/or important, they may wish to use that to choose between otherwise comparable services.

clauses.title: ToS;DR provides information on its password security mechanism
clauses.description: It's important to know what security measures are taken to protect your data from unauthorized access. This case applies to the Agreements that precisely explain their security practices.

clauses.title: The terms for ToS;DR are easy to read
clauses.description: The Agreements are well-organised, define legal terms (where applicable), aren't needlessly long and may be pleasant to read.

clauses.title: The service provides a free help desk
clauses.description: The service can be easily contacted for questions or provides a support center at no extra cost.

clauses.title: ToS;DR gives no guarantee regarding quality
clauses.description: The Service doesn't warrant or guarantee the quality of the products or services provided.
